Description: Set the assembly to the fixture
Make all necessary connections to assembly
Force ByPass Type code for R7
Measure and record actual line voltage
Calculate A/D DC Bus Level Count
Average 10 readings and compare to calculated limits
Read the status of digital inputs
Read the status of digital inputs
All measured values are to be recorded and saved, referenced to the assembly serial number.

Input Node/ Parameter: Removed special MODBUS commands. All control is now done through hidden parameters
Changed Input power supply to 175Vac from 165Vac to assure power supply start-up.
Added delays for Coil control test.
Changed limits in step 3.3 for 2,5vref and IFBK
Changed limits in step 1 for 90V and step 3.6 for Bus Voltage
Changed limits based on test data from units built between 10/01/2007 - 1/15/2008
Added delay for power supply voltages to settle prior to reading.  Modified DC bus measurement method for better accuracy.
Changed Limits for board revision measurement, step 3.3
Changed Limits for temporary increase of test voltage to 220vac. This is due to software error.
Also changed limits of three phase line meas to be based on actual line voltage reading
Changes to utilize the measurement of the input line voltage for calculation of limits. Due to highly distorted
line voltage at SVI the limits were increased until the software RMS filter time constant can be changed.
Increased upper 90V test limit from 97V to 99V.
